Posts.Content: Hi ladies, Oh yes, I’d love to try making the healthy cookies too.  It only crossed my mind this morning to look for the April radiotherapy thread (doh)! Who said I’m loosing my marbles! I have my 7th radiotherapy session today of 15 and so far so good. I’m using the R1 and R2 creams and can highly recommend them. Even better if you can get them on prescription from your doctor as the 6 week course costs about £70. The RT team at Derby Royal are lovely and don’t laugh at me when I wear a pair of gloves each day. Be warned ladies, that the machines are in rooms that have to be quite cool so hands above your head for as long as it takes do get chilly. The gloves really help! Love the mala photo. What considerate friends you have.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I’ve had my profile name changed as the team thought that I might be using my actual name, which I wasn’t, but hey ho! So, I was Penny Lane, but now I’m PennyL - but I’m actually Alison!!! I finished my rads last Wednesday and finally rang that bell! Yay! I felt very emotional leaving my tunic in the changing room. My tunic and I have been through it all together (and my gloves too, which I wore every day). I thought that all would return to “normal” after radiotherapy, but I started to feel very anxious a couple of weeks ago and worried that I wasn’t ready to return to work full time at the end of my sessions. My BCN rang me last Monday to see how I was getting on and I told her I was feeling quite overwhelmed at work so she asked me to go and see her the following day. When I did she explained that whilst I had accepted my diagnosis calmly and been through surgery, returned to work four weeks later, had radiotherapy and looked to all that I was coping well - I hadn’t taken any time to deal with all this s##t EMOTIONALLY.  I’ve now been signed off work for a month and whilst it’s a shock and I see it as a failure on my part, I now need to reflect on what this has all actually meant for me. Just me! We all worry about trying to cope with our loved ones and trying to carry on with all the normal day to day stuff that we always do, but we all need to do this FOR OURSELVES. I’m certainly no expert on this and it will be a strange time for me, but I’m taking this on board. I’m going to attend some Macmillan courses, which are free to all, and seek out mindfulness information and begin yoga, which I’ve always wanted to try, but never felt as though I had the time. I’m going to ask myself “what can I do today to make me happy?” I’m going to look after ME! I wanted to share these thoughts with you as I hope my setback might help you to not experience this. Be kind to yourself. Take time to really think. Give yourself a hug. You’ve been through a huge traumatic experience. You and I will feel yourself again very soon, we just need to give ourselves time xxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for your support and kind comments. I’m crying now. We will get there, but we’re not exactly sure where “there” is or how to get there!!! Big hugs to all
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi @fenouillard,  I am also on the Teva brand. My local Morrison’s are very happy to order that specific brand in for me. It arrives the following day.  Hope there’s one near you too.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Oh yes jacks77, I’d be up for seeing a counsellor. I’ve filled out a holistic questionnaire online which was supposed to be fed back to my BCN, but that didn’t happen, which is a shame. It’s being followed up now so should hear from them soon, I hope.  Sending you a mahoosive (great word) hug back!! Keep smiling xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi @Queenfisher Thank you so much for sharing your situation. Whilst I am very sorry to hear that you have hit your own wall, it is comforting to know that we are not alone in feeling this way. I too had family, friends and colleagues telling me that “you’re such a strong person” “you’re doing so well” which is lovely to hear that everyone thinks that of you, but inside, it seems that we are crumbing. I don’t think that you need to take anything further on at the moment with  a support group at your workplace and you must not feel guilty about not doing it at this time. It may be something that you can set up in the future, but definitely not now. You’ve got enough on right now - dealing with yourself. My BC nurse told me that generally, people who “fall apart” (her words) at their diagnosis fair better after their treatment. Those who (like me) take it in calmly, in shock, are far more likely not to deal with their emotions and it then bottles up and bites us on the bum later down the line!! I’m sure that is just a generalisation, but thought provoking! I will hopefully see a counsellor soon. I hope that the questions that they ask me will release answers from me that can help me move forward. I went to my first yoga class this morning and it was brilliant! It was a small group for beginners and concentrating on my breathing and the positions truly helped me stop thinking about anything else. Genuine “me” time. What a tonic and a totally new experience. One step forward. Thank you so much for your good wishes and supportive words. I hope that you too (and all that read this post) can take that much needed time for yourself.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Lol! Why did that print out so huge!!
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi @mumof3plusoh (why won’t it tag?) Very best of luck with your last zap tomorrow. There’s nothing wrong with crying in front of your mum! You’ve been through a great ordeal - you still are!! Let it all out, if you want to.
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Shirl3, You certainly have had it tough and are understandably feeling down and trapped into your next round of treatment..  I’m nearly two weeks post surgery and have an appointment on 22nd February to discuss my radiotherapy treatment which I think will start in March. I’ve had the results of my surgery, which, thankfully, were clear margins and no spread to the nodes, so you think to yourself - why do I need any radiotherapy? But I will definitely be having it. I don’t want to risk any little blighters sneaking anywhere else! Come on lady - you can do this! You need a distraction - check out a thread called “walking back to happiness” on here. Just a bunch of us posting our attempts to improve our days by getting outside. You don’t have to join in, of course, but check out the photos and look at the comments of how it is improving how we feel. Helping us cope with life at the moment. Join us, when you are able. Sending you a gentle hug xx
Posts.Title: Anyone refused radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Afternoon at Black Rocks near Matlock. We had a lovely walk and I have to say it was a much better day than last Tuesday, as that was when I had my lumpectomy and node biopsy! This picture was taken shortly after we arrived so not much walking done at this point ... but gentle high five to me for reaching BOTH my arms in the air.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi to all, Our week in Nefyn sure is doing me the power of good. We set off this morning and walked to the end of the headland next to Nefyn golf club (not many golfers out today thank goodness, so no flying balls!!) Here are a couple of photos for you. Looks like they were taken on 2 different days, but one had the sun out and the other must have been when it clouded over.  The sea was like a pond - never seen it like that before. How are you clever ladies tagging us? I can’t find how to do it! Help muchly appreciated! Aspen, I hope that you talk to a few close relatives or friends about how you feel. No need to keep things to yourself to protect them - you need them now. I’m sure if the boot was on the other foot you would want to be there for them - if you don’t ask for their support in your lows then you won’t be able to share your highs - which I hope you will enjoy some time very soon. Hang in their girl Xx Had a great panoramic view to share with you, but it won’t let me as the file is too big!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Evening all! (Knees bending as in Dixon of dock green (who??)) I only took Steve the dog for a short walk this morning as my daughter was taking me into town at 12. Well it all counts, doesn’t it? Debenhams, M&S, monsoon, Oasis, Dorothy Perkins, Phase 8 etc, etc. Well, she was looking for a new coat and it was very hard to find (she’s very fussy!) Have a lovely break in France, Leolady!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: What a lovely photo, Happybird! Where is it? I travelled to Nefyn yesterday with my husband and we had our first walk on the beach this morning. The sun was shining, but the wind was bracing! Certainly blew all the cobwebs away. Took a flask of coffee and some malted milk biscuits (we know how to live it up ).
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning all! just a couple of ramblings from me this morning! My daughter works in a country pub and she was serving a couple of lovely ladies and they got talking. My daughter was telling them about me and dropped the BC bomb into the conversation. When they left they gave her a £10 tip!! She said she felt so bad and had to confess to me that she thought that I was the reason that had done this. Lol! Every cloud........ Also, Happybird, you mentioned that you like yorkies. Yesterday I went for a walk to the park with my dog and met a couple walking their puppy. It was a yorkie x poodle, 11 weeks old. She was gorgeous and I told them so. They said “oh my goodness, she’s a nightmare! We call her the Yorkshire terrorist!! Ha ha! Really made me smile. Have a good weekend all xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: It’s ABSOLUTELY P@@@@D IT DOWN ALL DAY! Still been out for 3 hours with waterproofs head to toe! Now back “home“ with dry clothes on warming up with a cup of tea and a Welsh cake. I started taking my tablets last night. Is anyone else on anastrozole? I woke up this morning and expected to have grown an extra head or something!! Why does all this have to be so scary? The side effects sounded horrendous when I read them last Thursday so I decided not to take them straight away as I was going away on holiday the following day. So, now I’ve forgotten most of them, I thought I’d better start taking them - we have no choice really do we? Rant over!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lol! So it’s old editor to add photos and new editor to add emoji’s! Good luck with that ladies! We’ll really have to plan ahead what we want to post as if you switch between the two! I think all will be lost! Off for a walk in the rain with the dog now (sad emoji with tear]! xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: What’s this? Such a strange and welcome sight this morning!!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Yay! You did it, Leolady! I went for a walk yesterday with my daughter and German pointer. Before all this “diagnosis” I was used to walking alone but it was lovely to be with her, as my responsible adult, and I enjoyed having a natter with her on our short trek.  Steve (the dog) enjoyed it immensely too, but heaven only knows what he ate out there because when he was back home he threw up on my lounge carpet!!!! I can’t seem to find the “scrubbing your carpet” excercise on my list from the physio, but it had to be done! I hope that I can work out how to post a photo on here - of my walk, not of the carpet - lol   My husband has a day off with me today, so we’re taking a picnic to somewhere nearby and enjoying a walk in the countryside.  I’ll let you know how it goes. Wishing you all a happy Tuesday x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi to all from wet and windy Wales! Can’t believe that our week is nearly over. It has been so good to get away from it all. Back to Derby on Friday. Today, we went to Portmeirion and Criccieth. It has been a lovely day, but I’m very tired now. Sat writing this in front of a log fire that hubby has made. (Bless). On the subject of bras! I spent £20 on a bra from m&s and my £5 primark one is far comfier - although at the end of the day can’t wait to get all of them off! Let them free! And relax! Here are a couple of my views from today for you.  Look after yourselves xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Oh my days, this weather is awful! I did mean to go out today,but .... I didn’t. You are all being so good with your efforts too. I will definitely make more effort tomorrow. Jacmatholmad so sorry to hear that you had a set back.  Its been a strange day. No motivation. Then hubby arrived home at lunch time and disappeared into the garage. Said that he wanted to finish making my valentines present!! This is it! It’s a lily. About 2 feet tall (in old money) and made of metal. He now says that he’s going to make me the rest of the bunch. I’m going to need a very big vase and a sturdy table! It is beautiful. Really made me happy. Roll on spring ladies xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi all,  It was a busy day, yesterday.  Out with my daughter again with the dogs then off to the hospital for my results from lumpectomy and node biopsy. Given the all clear on both counts! So utterly thrilled. Thank you all for being here for me. It has been so lovely to read all of the enthusiasm and determination on this thread over these past few days. We all torment ourselves with the “what ifs” when we are waiting for the dreaded results days, don’t we?  This thread has kept my spirits up.  Next step for me is with the radiotherapy department on 22nd February. My husband is taking me away for a week in Wales today. We want to walk by the sea. Come to terms with the turmoil that’s been thrown at us over the past few weeks and count our blessings. love and best wishes to you all. xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Mr sox, best of luck with your first chemo tomorrow. Best of luck to all others with appointments or results this week xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Right here goes! Leolady56  yay! It works! How the hells-bells did you and everyone else find that out???? I feel like a whole new world has opened up to me! (And I’m now singing that song in my head) Thank you! X
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi all, Now, all this walking is making my hair very knotty, due to the wind and the hat that I’m wearing. So to get round this I am having to wear my hair in plaits! Which is fine, but making me look rather silly, as I’m 57. Am I risking a case of Pocahontas-itis?? I am trying to avoid this as I already have swishy trousers syndrome from wearing my waterproof trousers. Have a good day everyone. mrsox - how are you feeling after your first chemo? Hope you’re ok xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Oh whathappened! I’m so sorry to hear that you have felt so down for so long. I hope that you have friends and family nearby that you can share how you feel and to take you out for a little lunch or a jaunt In the car. If you stay home all the time it’s bound to affect you are feeling. We must work together to raise your mood and get you back out there more. I too, am loving this thread. When I’m out for a walk I’m looking for “the view” that I want to share with you all. I haven’t told anyone that I’m writing on here. You are all my secret. My allies, because you know exactly how I’m feeling, what I’m experiencing, how to cheer me up and how to pick me up when I’m down. I don’t want anyone that I know in the “outside world” to be looking for me on here - to know what I’ve written or see the photos that I’ve shared with you - these are just for you. In our little supportive bubble. Happy Sunday everyone. Hope your day is a good one. One step at a time.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Erm! Can I just say sorry to you because when I’ve heard your “voice” in my head, I thought you were a man! Mr Sox!! Well men can suffer with this too - right? But I’ve only just realised that you’re Mrs Ox!! Lol! So sorry (different “voice” in my head from this moment onwards!!) Next walk out for us in our week in Wales, was to Pwllheli today, a walk along the cardigan bay. It was a lovely sunny day, but there was snow on the hills in the distance.  Pub lunch and then back to our cottage for my husband to watch the rugby (yawn). Time for a bath I think!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hello? ...... anyone there? Lol. I tried 3 times to post on the thread yesterday, but failed. It feels like you’ve sent me to Coventry! Lol. Well here goes.... again... sorry if some bits relate to fridays posts. Hi all @toxophilite Hell yes, of course all those stairs count! @Cannon What a great incentive! I need to get one of those! @whathappened I too, look to this thread for motivation, but if you are tired, then give into it. This is not a race and there’s always tomorrow (which might not be tomorrow, but will follow some time very soon) (tagging is not working this morning - it was, when I first typed this, but then I clicked off the site to look for photos and when I came back, all that I had written had disappeared so I’ve had to start again and now it’s not working!!) note to self to do what @leolady does and type in word first! I didn’t go for a walk yesterday (Friday) as we were packing up to travel home. Arrived home at 6pm and brought my case upstairs. It was strange to see my “normal bed” a place where I have cried alone over these past few weeks. A place where I have laid awake in the night and worried what the future had in store for me. Bit of a surprise, as I hadn’t expected that. Here are a couple of pics from our journey home through Snowdonia. So beautiful. If you ever get the chance to go there, then do!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lol! Leolady56 ! 8 miles? You need a medal as well as a bath! Think Mr Leo needs to massage your feet this evening (winking emoji) Violetsniff you may start a new trend! How are you going to fasten it to your face? A pretty ribbon, blu tac? I can’t help getting a vision of what’s his name from silence of the lambs - Anthony Hopkins, so perhaps make one with a flower design on it to stop you looking like him.  I did make it out today: blue sky, sun out and evidence that spring is on its way. YAY!! This shot was taken in my local park.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Oh ShimmeringUnicorn, I’ve just spat my tea out, reading about your friend with the bull midriff!! Ha ha, bloody predictive text! Not posted for a few days, but I’ve been keeping up with the thread as my bedtime reading - you mad lot. I’ve been to stay with my older daughter in Liverpool for a couple of days, driven by younger daughter.  It was lovely to spend quality time with them both. We did lots of walking, some in parks and some round the shops. I enjoyed every moment.  Back home now and worrying about being off work / returning to work / do I feel ready? Generally beating myself up. Been off for 4 weeks so far, which in the grand scheme of things, isn’t that long, is it? I would LOVE to meet up with you crazy lot and give actual gentle hugs. lots of love xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness
